citations.narrative:
Two litters of weaned puppies do not have any form of official identification. Official identification allows for positive means
of identifying individual animals as well as allows for the tracking of animals through the kennel. Weaned puppies must be
identified by tags, tattoos, plastic-type collars or cage cards with the required information. Correct by 5 February 2024.

Twenty puppies did not have any form of a written record of acquisition available during the inspection. Current and
complete inventory records allows for the tracking of the movement of animals into and out of the kennel. All dogs
(including puppies) must have required information recorded on USDA form 7005 or, in the case of puppies on cage
cards. Correct by 5 February 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Two litters of weaned puppies do not have any form of official identification. Official identification allows for positive means 
of identifying individual animals as well as allows for the tracking of animals through the kennel. Weaned puppies must be 
identified by tags, tattoos, plastic-type collars or cage cards with the required information. Correct by 5 February 2024. 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Twenty puppies did not have any form of a written record of acquisition available during the inspection. Current and 
complete inventory records allows for the tracking of the movement of animals into and out of the kennel. All dogs 
(including puppies) must have required information recorded on USDA form 7005 or, in the case of puppies on cage 
cards. Correct by 5 February 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
